title: Kevin Jonas Tells Brother Nick He Was 'Way Too Intense' for Being 7 Years Old
description: The Jonas Brothers kicked off their JONAS20: Greetings From Your Hometown Tour on Sunday, Aug. 10 in New Jersey
content:
NEED TO KNOW
• None Kevin Jonas said that his younger brother Nick had been "way too intense" as a 7-year-old
• None The Jonas Brothers appeared on the Aug. 12 episode of Hot Ones Versus to challenge, which aired days after they kicked off their JONAS20: Greetings From Your Hometown Tour
• None The band will trek through North America from August to November celebrating 20 years as a band

Kevin Jonas thinks Nick Jonas needed to take a breath when he was a kid.

On the Tuesday, Aug. 12 episode of Hot Ones Versus featuring the Jonas Brothers, Kevin, 37, took aim at Nick, 32, for being "way too intense" as a child.

"The three of us have been together 24/7 since we were kids. What childhood habit of mine annoyed you the most when we lived together?" Nick asked Kevin during the first round of the hot wing eating challenge.

Never miss a story — sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer​​, from celebrity news to compelling human interest stories.

"You're way too intense for being 7 years old," Kevin responded, to which Nick agreed.

"We went on a family vacation and you decided, 'No, I'm not going to go on this cruise with my family. I'm going to stay home and work on Broadway,' " the eldest JoBro continued, adding that it was "impressive."

Joe Jonas said that the cruise was "the s---," reminiscing on winning a hula hooping contest and drinking countless Shirley Temples with Kevin.

As for missing out on the family vacation, Nick concluded, "I don't regret it at all."

The "Who I Am" singer acted on Broadway as a child, appearing in Annie Get Your Gun, Beauty and the Beast and Les Misérables. In 2012, Nick returned to the stage for How to Succeed in Business Without Really Trying.

Most recently, Nick starred in The Last Five Years on Broadway alongside Adrienne Warren.

The Jonas Brothers kicked off their JONAS20: Greetings From Your Hometown Tour on Sunday, Aug. 10, at MetLife Stadium in East Rutherford, N.J.

The band will make stops in Virginia Beach, Syracuse, Boston, Dallas, San Francisco and other cities through August, September and October in North America. They conclude the tour in Uncasville, Conn., on Nov. 14.

Ahead of their tour's start date, Nick told PEOPLE about how their catalog had aged well since the band got its start 20 years ago.

"It's aged very well. It's one of those things where we've looked out and seen the fan base really evolve and change and there's sort of a generational aspect to it now when you think about it," he said in July.



"The people that were our age back when we were teens touring and making music are our age now and they've grown up and they're bringing their kids to the shows, but their parents that brought them when they were in their youth still want to come."

The PEOPLE Puzzler crossword is here! How quickly can you solve it? Play now!

Joe also teased what fans can expect from attending their latest tour, speaking with PEOPLE in June.

"I think what fans can expect is that we are going to do what we can to give them the best show they can possibly enjoy every night. Really have a fun time on the road, enjoy the fact that we get to do this after all these years and just try to bring something different," he said.
summary: Kevin Jonas, the brother of Nick Jonas, said he was "way too intense" as a child during the Aug. 12 episode of Hot Ones Versus. This comment came after the Jonas Brothers announced their JONAS20: Greetings From Your Hometown Tour, celebrating their 20 years together. The tour will take place in North America from August to November. Nick recently starred in The Last Five Years on Broadway alongside Adrienne Warren. The Jonas Brothers kicked off their tour on August 10 at MetLife Stadium in East Rutherford, N.J.
shortSummary: Kevin Jonas criticized his brother for being too intense as a child, while the Jonas Brothers launched their 20th tour in North America.

scraped_sources.text: Joe Jonas and Kevin Jonas Support Brother Nick Jonas on Broadway as The Last Five Years with Adrienne Warren Debuts The revival of Jason Robert Brown's beloved musical officially opens on Sunday, April 6, for a strictly limited, 14-week-only engagement By Dave Quinn Dave Quinn Dave Quinn is the Deputy News Director at PEOPLE. He has been working at the brand since 2016, and is the author of the No. 1 New York Times best-selling book, Not All Diamonds and Rosé: The Inside Story of the Real Housewives from the People Who Lived It. People Editorial Guidelines Published on March 19, 2025 05:35AM EDT Leave a Comment Kevin Jonas, Nick Jonas, Adrienne Warren and Joe Jonas backstage at 'The Last Five Years' on Broadway. Credit : Andy Henderson Welcome back to Broadway, Nick Jonas and Adrienne Warren! The two stage actors returned to the boards on Tuesday, March 18, as director Whitney White's revival of The Last Five Years kicked off preview performances at the Hudson Theatre in New York City. And they had two special people cheering them on: Nick's brothers and bandmates, Joe Jonas and Kevin Jonas. Posing together for a photo on stage after the performance, the Jonas Brothers were all smiles as they surrounded Nick, 32, and Warren, 37, Never miss a story — sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer, from celebrity news to compelling human interest stories. Prior to that, the pair made their first bows to a standing crowd of enthusiastic theatergoers. They then celebrated their debut with a congratulatory hand slap and a hug, according to video of the milestone shared on the show's official Instagram account. Nick and Warren were then joined by White, who welcomed three-time Tony Award winner Jason Robert Brown — the composer, lyricists and book writer of The Last Five Years — to the stage. It was a special moment for Brown; despite his musical first premiering in 2001, the production marks the first time the show has ever been on Broadway. "Giving a big cheers to him for the Broadway debut of The Last Five Years," White said, presenting Brown with flowers. Joe Jonas shares a photo from the audience of 'The Last Five Years' as he supports his brother Nick Jonas. Joe Jonas/Instagram Nick Jonas and Adrienne Warren Belt from Broadway's The Last Five Years in First Listen at Upcoming Revival (Exclusive) The Last Five Years follows the demise of a relationship between a rising novelist named Jamie (Nick) and a struggling actress named Cathy (Warren), across two different timelines. His perspective is told in chronological order from when the couple first got together, while hers is told in reverse, from the end of their marriage. "Putting the whole thing together has been an absolute joy," Nick said during a joint appearance with Warren on The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon earlier this month. "We're having the best time." "He's such an incredible teammate and such a hard worker," Warren added of Nick. "He ups the ante every single day and I'm like, 'Wait a minute. I gotta step up!' " Adrienne Warren and Nick Jonas in 'The Last Five Years' on Broadway. Matthew Murphy The PEOPLE Puzzler crossword is here! How quickly can you solve it? Play now! Nick went on to call playing Jamie "a dream role," but admitted in a video on The Last Five Years' Instagram account that doing the show feels "very intense." "It’s natural to feel a little nervous, so I’m trying to step into this with real focus and confidence. But it’s a big show and it’s got a lot of fans over the world," he said. Adrienne Warren in 'The Last Five Years' on Broadway. Matthew Murphy Nick Jonas and Adrienne Warren Sing Bittersweet Duet About Love in New Music Video for Broadway's The Last Five Years That would be an understatement. In the years since The Last Five Years premiered — first at Chicago's Northlight Theatre in 2001, and then, in a 2002 New York City production starring Norbert Leo Butz and Sherie Rene Scott Off-Broadway at the Minetta Lane Theater — the piece has become a favorite among the musical-theater crowd. Much of that is thanks to the Off-Broadway cast recording, which helped songs from the show like "Nobody Needs to Know," "Still Hurting," "If I Didn't Believe in You" and "The Next Ten Minutes" become showtune staples. An Off-Broadway revival at New York City's Second Stage Theater came in 2013, with Adam Kantor and Betsy Wolfe in the roles of Jamie and Cathy. A year later, a movie adaptation was released starring Jeremy Jordan and Anna Kendrick. In 2016, a one-night-only concert of the musical was staged at New York City's Town Hall, led by Joshua Henry and Cynthia Erivo. That same year, a production of The Last Five Years opened in London led by Bridgerton and Wicked star Jonathan Bailey and Samantha Barks, a breakout star of the 2012 Les Misérables film. Nick Jonas in 'The Last Five Years' on Broadway. Matthew Murphy George Clooney, Denzel Washington, Sarah Snook and All the Celebrities Leading Broadway's Starriest Season Yet This revival of The Last Five Years officially opens on April 6. The limited-run production is currently set to play for just 14 weeks, through June 22. When the production was first announced back in June 2024, it came almost exactly 25 years to the date after Brown wrote the first song for The Last Five Years (June 15, 1999). "I have always believed that when the time was right, The Last Five Years would make its way to Broadway," he said in a statement at the time. As for Nick and Warren, their returns to Broadway are reason enough to celebrate. He was last in 2012's How to Succeed in Business Without Really Trying, while she is a 2021 Tony Award winner for her portrayal of Tina Turner in Tina, based on the music icon's life. Tickets to The Last Five Years are now on sale. Close Leave a Comment Read more: Entertainment Theater

Joe Jonas Reveals Why the Jonas Brothers' Upcoming Tour Will Be 'Different' from Their Others (Exclusive) "I'm really excited," Joe tells PEOPLE of hitting the road again with his siblings Nick and Kevin as their band celebrates 20 years By Erin Clack Erin Clack Erin Clack is a Staff Editor for PEOPLE. She has been writing about fashion, parenting and pop culture for more than 15 years. People Editorial Guidelines and Hedy Phillips Hedy Phillips Hedy Phillips is the Senior Style News Editor at PEOPLE. She has been working at PEOPLE since 2022. Her work has previously appeared in POPSUGAR, HelloGiggles, Reader's Digest and more. People Editorial Guidelines Published on June 22, 2025 08:00AM EDT Leave a Comment Joe Jonas in 2025; Nick, Joe and Kevin Jonas in 2022. Credit : Jamie McCarthy/Getty; Richard Rodriguez/Getty NEED TO KNOW Joe Jonas told PEOPLE why the Jonas Brothers' upcoming tour will be “different” from their previous toursHe and siblings Nick and Kevin Jonas will kick off the Jonas20: Greetings from Your Hometown Tour on Aug. 10 in New JerseyThe tour marks the band's 20th anniversary and is tied to their seventh studio album, Greetings from Your Hometown Joe Jonas is teasing something big! The 35-year-old musician told PEOPLE in an exclusive interview that the Jonas Brothers' upcoming tour will deliver something completely "different" for fans than the band's past tours. Joe and siblings Nick Jonas and Kevin Jonas are set to kick off the Jonas20: Greetings from Your Hometown Tour on Aug. 10 at MetLife Stadium in their home state of New Jersey. "I think what fans can expect is that we are going to do what we can to give them the best show they can possibly enjoy every night. Really have a fun time on the road, enjoy the fact that we get to do this after all these years and just try to bring something different," Joe tells PEOPLE of the tour, which celebrates the group's 20th anniversary. The tour, which runs until November, will also be in support of the Jonas Brothers' upcoming seventh studio album, Greetings from Your Hometown, out on Aug. 8. Nick, Joe and Kevin Jonas on Sept. 24, 2024. Francesco Prandoni/Getty "We did a big tour last year or two years ago, it bled into the last year, but I think what we’ve really realized is that we wanted to bring a show for the audience that they felt like was something different from what they’ve experienced before," he continues, noting that the plan was to give fans a chance to offer input. "We’re going to build a show with our audience, so we’re rehearsing pretty much onstage and playing some of these older songs that we haven’t played in so many years and see how they respond and what they want to hear," he explains. As the setlist is still taking shape, Joe — who serves as an ambassador for Scotch & Soda and has a collaboration collection with the fashion brand — says he and his brothers are also still ironing out their onstage wardrobes for a tour that will get underway in the heat of summer, just after they perform in New York City for the 4th of July fireworks with Macy's. "We’re in the middle of figuring out what we’re going to wear, but we never really dress according to the weather. The stadiums outside, it’s like you don’t even... I think it’s going to be important because we’re going to be sweating through those outfits really fast," Joe tells PEOPLE. "Not much leather — there won’t be a lot of leather being worn," he predicts. "I mean, you know, fashion can hurt, but that's one choice that we will avoid." Related Stories JONASCON Is Hitting the Road — See If the Jonas Brothers Fan Experience Is Coming to a City Near You (Exclusive) Kevin Jonas Teases New Jonas Brothers Tour Details and Reveals His Favorite Song on the New Album (Exclusive) Reflecting on the 20-year milestone, Joe says it's a privilege and a thrill to still be doing what he loves, two decades later. "Twenty years in now, still being able to do what we love for a living and have so many supportive fans and people that show up for these shows and listen to our new music and stuff, it’s why it keeps us doing what we do," he explains. "I wake up every morning, [and] I’m ready. I get to do what I love for a living, so I’m happy to keep it going." Nick, Joe and Kevin Jonas on April 16, 2024. Mauricio Santana/Getty Kevin, 37, also opened up about the emotional milestone in a separate exclusive interview with PEOPLE in May. Never miss a story — sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer, from celebrity news to compelling human interest stories. “It’s just wild to think that we've been a part of people's lives for this long, but I think what's really cool is that it's still continuing to be new," he said at the time, promising a tour setlist that will mix both oldies and top hits. "We're constantly talking about the setlist, which is always a thing for us,” Kevin noted. “We've been building out the show conceptually and what we wanted it to feel and look like. It's gonna be really special. You know, it's 20 years of the band, but really it's just about us going back on the road to celebrate how many people have been with us for so long, and the fans that have been made this journey possible.” Close Leave a Comment Read more: Entertainment Music Pop Music

Jonas Brothers Kick Off Tour in Hometown N.J. Show Filled with Surprise Guests and Appearances from 2 Jonas Daughters JONAS20: Greetings From Your Hometown Tour began on Aug. 10 at MetLife Stadium in East Rutherford, New Jersey By Alexandra Schonfeld Alexandra Schonfeld Alexandra Schonfeld is a features writer at PEOPLE. She has been working at PEOPLE since April 2022. Her work previously appeared in Newsweek. People Editorial Guidelines Updated on August 11, 2025 05:45PM EDT Leave a Comment Nick, Joe and Kevin Jonas kick off their JONAS20: Greetings From Your Hometown Tour at MetLife Stadium on Aug. 10, 2025. Credit : Kevin Mazur/Getty NEED TO KNOW The Jonas Brothers kicked off their JONAS20: Greetings From Your Hometown Tour on Aug. 10 at MetLife Stadium in New JerseyThey were joined by an array of surprise guests including Jesse McCartney and Demi LovatoTo cap off the show, Nick, Joe and Kevin Jonas were joined by their entire family on stage to perform "When You Look Me in the Eyes" The Jonas Brothers are on the road again. Nick, Joe and Kevin Jonas kicked off their JONAS20: Greetings From Your Hometown Tour on Aug. 10 at MetLife Stadium in New Jersey. The show began with a set from the All-American Rejects, who are joining the brothers for various dates and who played a set filled with all their biggest hits, including “Dirty Little Secret” and “Gives You Hell.” When it was time for the Jonas Brothers to hit the stage, they did so in front of a set that paid tribute to the George Washington Bridge and the Lincoln and Holland Tunnels. As Nick, 32, explained later in the show, the landmarks called back to their early days as a band and their many trips back and forth between New York City and their native New Jersey. Nick Jonas and Jon Foreman of Switchfoot in East Rutherford, New Jersey on Aug. 10, 2025. Kevin Mazur/Getty In a departure from their last tour, which opened with “Celebrate!” from 2023's The Album, JONAS20 kicked off on a more nostalgic note with “Lovebug,” off their 2008 album A Little Bit Longer. The band then jumped into “Love Me to Heaven” the first single off their latest record Greetings From Your Hometown, which dropped on Aug. 8. In line with the theme of the evening, all three brothers paid tribute to their home state through their first wardrobe choices, with Nick sporting a Wyckoff, N.J. varsity-style jacket, Joe, 35, rocking a studded jean jacket with the words “Mom’s favorite” and “New Jersey USA” on the back and Kevin, 37, who still lives in the Garden State, wearing a Jersey-themed patched jacket. Jesse McCartney and the Jonas Brothers perform at MetLife Stadium in East Rutherford, New Jersey on Aug. 10, 2025. Kevin Mazur/Getty As promised, the band had several big surprises in store for opening night. The first came along when Switchfoot, who the brothers credit with being one of their earliest inspirations, joined them on stage to perform “Meant to Live," off Switchfoot's 2003 album The Beautiful Letdown. The bands later sang “Hold On,” which the Jonas Brothers have said was inspired by Switchfoot. Our new app is here! Free, fun and full of exclusives. Scan to download now! Later, the Jonas Brothers welcomed Jesse McCartney to the stage to perform “Beautiful Soul” after explaining that they had toured with him nearly 20 years ago at the start of their career. About an hour into their set, the trio stepped off stage for Marshmello — who along with All-American Rejects and Boys Like Girls — is slated to perform on the tour in various cities. The DJ went through a setlist of some of his biggest hits, turning MetLife Stadium into a club on a Sunday night. Nick Jonas and Marshmello in East Rutherford, New Jersey on Aug. 10, 2025. Kevin Mazur/Getty To close out his set, the Jonas Brothers returned to the stage and Marshmello grabbed a guitar to perform their collaboration “Leave Before You Love Me.” The special guests kept coming, and they later welcomed Dean Lewis, who is featured on their new album, to the stage to perform their song “Loved You Better” together. Related Stories Exes Demi Lovato and Joe Jonas Reunite for 'Camp Rock' Performance as The Jonas Brothers Kick Off 20th Anniversary Tour The Jonas Brothers' 20th Anniversary Tour Setlist Includes Their Solo Work and 'Pee Breaks' As the band continued to look back at their 20 years together, they also revisited some of Nick and Joe’s solo music through what they called a “Versus Megamix,” which saw the two brothers take turns performing some of their biggest songs from their respective Nick Jonas and the Administration and DNCE eras. The Jonas Brothers perform with Demi Lovato at MetLife Stadium in East Rutherford, New Jersey on Aug. 10, 2025. Kevin Mazur/Getty One of the biggest surprises of the night, however, came toward the end of the show, when the trio began reflecting on their early days with Disney, particularly their involvement in the Camp Rock movies. After Joe, who played pop star Shane Gray in the film, sang "Gotta Find You,” he welcomed his former costar Demi Lovato to the stage to sing “This Is Me.” The two, who played onscreen love interests in the film and also enjoyed a short-lived relationship in real life, then sang their iconic duet "Wouldn't Change a Thing.” Around 11 p.m., as the concert was coming to an end, the brothers welcomed their entire immediate family to the stage, including youngest brother Franklin Jonas, mom Denise Jonas and dad Kevin Jonas Sr. to perform 2007’s “When You Look Me in the Eyes.” Later in the song, Kevin’s wife Danielle Jonas walked out on stage with the couple’s daughters Valentina, 8, and Alena, 11, who joined Kevin Sr. at the piano. Aug. 10 marked the first night of the tour that will take them across the country through November. For fans who don’t have tickets to see the show in person, Samsung TV Plus will be broadcasting four more tour dates on the streamer’s brand-new Samsung Television Network (STN). Close Leave a Comment Read more: Entertainment Music Pop Music

'Tina — The Tina Turner Musical' Team React to Singer's Death: Her 'Legacy Lives On' Tina Turner died Wednesday after a long illness at her home in Switzerland, her publicist confirmed Wednesday By Tommy McArdle Tommy McArdle Tommy McArdle is a writer-reporter on the Movies team at PEOPLE. Tommy joined PEOPLE in 2022. People Editorial Guidelines Updated on May 24, 2023 05:38PM EDT The team behind the hit Broadway musical based on Tina Turner's life and career are mourning the late singer and musician after her death at age 83. Following news of Turner's death Wednesday, the official Instagram account for Tina — The Tina Turner Musical shared a statement noting that her "legacy lives on in so many beautiful ways as we mourn a legendary woman." "Tina Turner’s contribution as an iconic music artist and performer, her influence on fellow artists and her inspiration to generations who followed her, is legendary," the statement reads, alongside a portrait of Turner. "Through her life story and her music, Tina Turner inspired and taught so many people around the world to find strength from within," the statement continues. "This is a loss that will be deeply felt. Words can’t express our feelings, so we look to one another to share the love, respect andkindness that she shared with us." Bruce Glikas/WireImage, Pete Still/Redferns The musical, which remains in production on tour following its closing date on Broadway back in August, received 12 nominations at the 74th Tony Awards. Adrienne Warren, who originated the musical's lead role as Turner in its West End inception and original Broadway run, won best actress in a musical at the show, Tina Turner's Life in Photos A statement on the production's official website shares that performances of the musical "will continue as planned" after the icon's death. The touring musical is currently in production at the Eccles Center Salt Lake City through June 4, with performances planned around the country until Aug. 4, 2024. "Our love, thoughts, and prayers are with Erwin Bach and Tina’s family," the production added in its statement on Instagram Wednesday. "TINA: The Tina Turner Musical is a true celebration of this exceptional woman, and in our mourning we continue to celebrate her life, her talent and her joy." Never miss a story — sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer, from juicy celebrity news to compelling human interest stories. Turner died Wednesday, May 24 after a long illness at her home near Zürich in Switzerland, her publicist Bernard Doherty confirmed in a statement. Tina Turner and Adrienne Warren in 2019. Walter McBride/WireImage Angela Bassett Says She Wasn't 'Robbed' of an Oscar for Playing Tina Turner: 'Too Negative of an Emotion' "With her, the world loses a music legend and a role model," the statement read. "There will be a private funeral ceremony attended by close friends and family. Please respect the privacy of her family at this difficult time." Turner, who had lived in Switzerland since 1994 with her husband Erwin Bach, had battled a number of serious health problems in the years prior to her death, including a stroke, intestinal cancer and total kidney failure that required an organ transplant. She earned her Swiss citizenship in 2013. Read more: Celebrity Celebrity Deaths Celebrity Death News

argos_summary: Kevin Jonas recently reflected on his younger brother Nick's intensity as a child during an episode of Hot Ones Versus, stating that Nick was 'way too intense' at just seven years old. The Jonas Brothers are currently on their JONAS20: Greetings From Your Hometown Tour, which began on August 10, 2025, celebrating their 20-year career with performances across North America. The tour features nostalgic elements and surprise guests, aiming to create a unique experience for fans.
